page.title: 10 LYNNBOTTOM DUMP 1
page.content: These days our society is a throwaway society: because of this there are great problems in getting rid of all the rubbish. The Lynnbottom dump covers about 20 acres and it is positioned approximately 2.5km East of Newport. The dump deals with 70,000 tonnes of rubbish a year,50,000 tonnes of rubble and earth and 15,000 tonnes of paper which is collected from the civic community compound. The refuse lorries from Bembridge,Sandown,Shanklin,Yarmouth and Shalfleet all go to Lynnbottom dump. The dump has been there for about 15 years and is only expected to last 2_3 years until it is completely full. Before the dump was built it was a copse with a river running through it.
